p: Cinnamomum zeylanicum consisting of ( E)-cinnamaldehyde (CAL) (81.39%) and ( E)-cinnamyl acetate (CAS) (4.20%) as the main compounds showed over 78.0% inhibitory activity in cholinesterase. In MAO-A and MAO-B inhibition assays, EOs from C. zeylanicum (96.44%, 95.96%) and CAL (96.32%, 96.29%) demonstrated comparable activity to rasagiline (97.42%, 97.38%, respectively). Research by Murata and co-workers [ 69] found that kaur-16-ene, nezukol, and ferruginol isolated from plants had anti-AChE (IC 50) activity at 640, 300 and 95 Î¼m, respectively. Even though ferruginol activity has already been highlighted before, by Gulacti et al. [ 213], this study documented the activities of kaur-16-ene and nezukol for the first time.
